title: No Girls 2015 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas pop in notes of sea breeze, dried nori, flower, wet stone, peat, white pepper and strawberry, showing a lot of complexity. The palate is elegant but intensely flavorful. A smoked meat finish carries as long as you care to count, kicking it up a notch.

title: Bründlmayer NV Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A rich tone of baked apple fills both nose and palate. Yeasty development is expressed as buttery patisserie notes, while lemony brightness lends a fresh, vivid aspect. The fizz is fine and very creamy. This is rich in its slenderness, opulent in stone fruit and flavor and yet ultrafresh. The long finish brims with ripe lemon. Drink now–2025.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Reserve

title: Archery Summit 2015 Summit Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A portion was fermented in concrete, which adds some interesting texture to the mouthfeel. The rest, done in small open-top fermenters, contributes light hints of leaf and stem. It's a complex and palate-thrilling mix of citrus, berry, Bing cherry and breakfast tea, beautifully balanced and long.

title: Barons de Rothschild 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This vintage Blanc de Blancs completes what is now a full range produced for all the Rothschild family-owned properties in Bordeaux. It is full of minerality as well as crisp intensity. The fruit is almost mature while still fresh and tangy. This textured Champagne will be best from 2020.

title: Bergström 2016 Bergström Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery's top cuvée is sourced from the original 1999 plantings. Intensely aromatic with complex suggestions of toast, spice and sandalwood, this is a wine to explore at length. The red and blue berry fruit flavors are framed with citrusy acidity, and the extended finish somehow conjures up salted caramel. It's a bit lighter and lower in alcohol than the 2015, but in terms of complexity and stylish detail, it's its equal.

title: Deutz 2010 Parcelles d'Aÿ Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: A new concept from this Aÿ-based producer, this wine showcases pure Pinot Noir from some of its finest parcels. The wine has weight and richness while not losing sight of elegance. The fruit is just beginning to mature, showing a crisp texture while promising a broader vision in the future. Drink from 2021.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Soy, tobacco and dried herb mark this appropriately named wine, which does indeed have a gravelly, chalky aspect to its texture and taste. From a five-acre vineyard block of the estate, it is endlessly complex and nuanced, despite its full-bodied richness and concentration.

title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Le Clos  (Vouvray)
description: Organically grown grapes from a single parcel go into this resplendent wine. Touched lightly by wood but much more focused on honey and apple, spice and intense acidity, the wine is ripe, peppery and set to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Rosamila  (Taurasi)
description: This opens with compelling aromas evoking pipe tobacco, Asian spice, blue flower, leather, menthol and baked plum. It's firmly structured, offering dried black cherry, blackberry, licorice, nutmeg and crushed aromatic herb. Fine-grained, velvety tannins give it grip as well as elegance. Drink 2022–2037.

title: Foxen 2016 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This block-designated wine is intense in hearty aromas of black raspberry, dried mint and loamy earth. Spiced cake and sharp purple-flower flavors arise on the palate, but it's the dark, penetrating and focused boysenberry and dark-fruit flavors that command attention. Drink 2019–2036.

title: Foxen 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an impressive array of aromas on the nose of this bottling, starting with light red cherry and pomegranate before intensifying into boysenberry jam with loads of star anise and dried ginger along the way. The mouthfeel is full, carrying boysenberry-jam flavors laced with sandalwood, myrrh and anise.

title: Foxen 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A bowlful of ripe red fruits, hibiscus and sharp cinnamon-laced potpourri make for an inviting nose to this single-vineyard expression. Bright acidity cuts through flavors of tart raspberry, pomegranate and baking spice on the taut palate, which is light in body but loaded with flavor. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Avize Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This explosive, ripe wine is part of a trilogy that the producer has made from three of the greatest villages in Champagne. This tense, mineral-driven wine is rich with white fruits. It is still young, so wait until 2020.

title: Franz Keller 2016 Franz Anton Schwarzer Adler Pinot Noir (Baden)
description: Pristine, pure fruit abounds in this exceptionally fresh, invigorating red. Crisp red-cherry and -plum flavors are accented by crushed minerals, blossoms and tobacco. Full bodied and plump in mouthfeel, it's balanced by fresh acidity and a hint of ash reminiscent of the Kaiserstuhl's volcanic origins. Lovely already, it should gain depth and complexity through 2030.

title: La Badina 2013  Lessona
description: Enticing aromas of wild berry, white pepper, blue flower and menthol mingle together on this linear fragrant red. Reflecting the nose, the precise vibrant palate offers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, aromatic herb and baking spice framed in taut, elegant tannins and bright acidity. It's all about finesse and balance, and will age and continue to develop for years. Drink 2020–2033.

title: Mumm Napa 2013 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Made from just a bit more Pinot Noir than Chardonnay, this is a lovely, complex and memorable wine, elegantly round and lengthy on the palate. A fleshiness of tangerine, peach and cherry complement the bright persistent acidity that has had time to mellow and integrate in the bottle.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Big but very agile, this full-bodied wine balances great fruit acidity with equally great richness in terms of ripe Anjou pear flavors and an almost thick, mouth-coating texture. The appearance has a faint green highlight in the yellow gold color, the aroma has toasted oak, butterscotch and apple, while the flavors nearly flood the palate with toasted almond, cream and baked pear.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Amazingly inviting aromas of rounded red cherry, wet slate, loam, vanilla, cracked pepper and dried herb show on the intense nose of this classic single-vineyard expression. Framed by sandy, nearly gritty tannins and a buoyant acidity, the flavors of ripe black cherry, tangy blackberry and wild herbs will only intensify with time. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Floral aromas lead to a ripe generously structured Port. The tannins may be firm but they are also rich bringing black-cherry fruits along with them. This is a wine with excellent potential. Drink from 2027.

title: Ramey 2015 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a well-made wine from several sites, including Cole Creek, Rodgers Creek and Alegria, all vineyard-designates of their own. Together, they sizzle in floral lavender, smoke and gamy meat. The Syrah is cofermented with 6% Viognier. The body is concentrated in ripeness and grip; let it mellow in the cellar and enjoy best 2025–2030.
